cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 105 mi E of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to begin drifting WNW overnight, then turn northwest Tuesday and curve north-northeast paralleling the Florida coast toward Georgia–South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of Georgia or South Carolina (most likely near Thursday morning)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch north of Golden Beach FL to Deerfield Beach FL; Hurricane Watch north of Deerfield Beach FL to Jupiter Inlet FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL; Storm Surge Warning Lantana FL to Altamaha Sound GA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida coastline from Miami-Dade northward through the Space Coast, then northward to the Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible at PortMiami (peak cumulative probability 19%, strongest winds most likely late Tuesday into Wednesday, gusts 35–45 mph if the western eyewall brushes the coast).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft above normal tides possible along Biscayne Bay; highest values expected north of Deerfield Beach.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with isolated 10 inches possible along the southeast Florida coast, producing localized flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along beaches; isolated tornado risk Tuesday.
